20110107140857.500|20110107140900.000|TR0|[[IV]]
20110107140900.000|20110107140902.500|TR0|
20110107140902.500|20110107140905.000|TR0|In Iraq, millions are living
20110107140905.000|20110107140907.500|TR0|below the poverty line despite
20110107140907.500|20110107140910.000|TR0|America's billion dollar
20110107140910.000|20110107140912.500|TR0|rebuilding program there.
20110107140912.500|20110107140915.000|TR0|
20110107140915.000|20110107140917.500|TR0|They often have to turn to the
20110107140917.500|20110107140920.000|TR0|garbage dump as a means to
20110107140920.000|20110107140923.333|TR0|survive.
20110107140923.333|20110107140926.667|TR0|
20110107140926.667|20110107140930.000|TR0|As RT's Sebastian Meyer reports,
20110107140930.000|20110107140932.500|TR0|for some of those driven from
20110107140932.500|20110107140935.000|TR0|their homes by sectarian
20110107140935.000|20110107140937.500|TR0|violence life is literally
20110107140937.500|20110107140940.000|TR0|
20110107140940.000|20110107140942.500|TR0|... rubbish.
20110107140942.500|20110107140945.000|TR0|
20110107140945.000|20110107140947.500|TR0|[[PKG]]
20110107140947.500|20110107140950.000|TR0|
20110107140950.000|20110107140952.500|TR0|At 7 am every morning Fatma
20110107140952.500|20110107140955.000|TR0|crouches outside her house and
20110107140955.000|20110107140957.500|TR0|along with her sister and
20110107140957.500|20110107141000.000|TR0|cousins begins to sort through
20110107141000.000|20110107141002.500|TR0|garbage. Displaced from southern
20110107141002.500|20110107141005.000|TR0|Iraq, Fatmas family is too poor
20110107141005.000|20110107141007.500|TR0|to send her to school and so she
20110107141007.500|20110107141010.000|TR0|works 8 hours a day sorting
20110107141010.000|20110107141012.500|TR0|through Baghdads landfill,
20110107141012.500|20110107141015.000|TR0|collecting plastic and metal
20110107141015.000|20110107141017.500|TR0|that will be shipped abroad for
20110107141017.500|20110107141020.000|TR0|recycling.  Her reward for
20110107141020.000|20110107141022.500|TR0|carting 40 pounds of trash
20110107141022.500|20110107141025.000|TR0|around?  Two dollars and fifty
20110107141025.000|20110107141027.500|TR0|cents.
20110107141027.500|20110107141030.000|TR0|
20110107141030.000|20110107141032.500|TR0|STUP Sebastian Meyer Behind me
20110107141032.500|20110107141035.000|TR0|sits acres of Baghdads trash.
20110107141035.000|20110107141037.500|TR0|To many this is just waste, but
20110107141037.500|20110107141040.000|TR0|for the families here, this is
20110107141040.000|20110107141042.500|TR0|not only their livelihood, but
20110107141042.500|20110107141045.000|TR0|also their home.
20110107141045.000|20110107141047.500|TR0|
20110107141047.500|20110107141050.000|TR0|Over 2,000 people live on
20110107141050.000|20110107141052.500|TR0|Baghdads landfill, Al-Tajiat,
20110107141052.500|20110107141055.000|TR0|making their homes out of the
20110107141055.000|20110107141057.500|TR0|garbage that the rest of the
20110107141057.500|20110107141100.000|TR0|city throws away.  There is no
20110107141100.000|20110107141102.500|TR0|running water or electricity and
20110107141102.500|20110107141105.000|TR0|certainly no access to medical
20110107141105.000|20110107141107.500|TR0|treatment.  If someone gets
20110107141107.500|20110107141110.000|TR0|sick, they have to be taken to
20110107141110.000|20110107141112.500|TR0|hospital the same way they get
20110107141112.500|20110107141115.000|TR0|drinking water.  By donkey cart.
20110107141115.000|20110107141117.500|TR0|
20110107141117.500|20110107141120.000|TR0|Tabar Mutar Hassan Al-Musawi
20110107141120.000|20110107141123.333|TR0|(Tribal Leader) Can you believe
20110107141123.333|20110107141126.667|TR0|that an Iraqi would live in a
20110107141126.667|20110107141130.000|TR0|shack made from garbage?  People
20110107141130.000|20110107141132.500|TR0|hoped for development and change
20110107141132.500|20110107141135.000|TR0|so we could say that Iraq is
20110107141135.000|20110107141137.500|TR0|still a wonderful place, blessed
20110107141137.500|20110107141140.000|TR0|by god.  The old regime is gone
20110107141140.000|20110107141142.500|TR0|and we have a new government,
20110107141142.500|20110107141145.000|TR0|but look at our situation.
20110107141145.000|20110107141147.500|TR0|Were living in shacks.
20110107141147.500|20110107141150.000|TR0|
20110107141150.000|20110107141152.500|TR0|America is spending $53 billion
20110107141152.500|20110107141155.000|TR0|dollars on the reconstruction
20110107141155.000|20110107141157.500|TR0|effort in Iraq, but the
20110107141157.500|20110107141200.000|TR0|residents of Al-Tajiat havent
20110107141200.000|20110107141202.500|TR0|seen a dime of it. What they
20110107141202.500|20110107141205.000|TR0|have seen, though, is the
20110107141205.000|20110107141207.500|TR0|sectarian violence that drove
20110107141207.500|20110107141210.000|TR0|them from their homes 5 years
20110107141210.000|20110107141212.500|TR0|ago.
20110107141212.500|20110107141215.000|TR0|
20110107141215.000|20110107141217.500|TR0|Naima Faisal (Unemployed) We
20110107141217.500|20110107141220.000|TR0|used to live in Abu-Ghraib, you
20110107141220.000|20110107141222.500|TR0|know.  Then America came.  The
20110107141222.500|20110107141225.000|TR0|war increased in Iraq.  People
20110107141225.000|20110107141227.500|TR0|started killing each other and
20110107141227.500|20110107141230.000|TR0|so we fled because we were
20110107141230.000|20110107141232.500|TR0|afraid.
20110107141232.500|20110107141235.000|TR0|
20110107141235.000|20110107141237.500|TR0|In 2005, Naimas family moved to
20110107141237.500|20110107141240.000|TR0|the landfill and has been living
20110107141240.000|20110107141242.500|TR0|there ever since, too afraid and
20110107141242.500|20110107141245.000|TR0|too poor to return home.
20110107141245.000|20110107141247.500|TR0|
20110107141247.500|20110107141250.000|TR0|Faizia al-Obaidiy (MP on the
20110107141250.000|20110107141252.500|TR0|Iraqia List)
20110107141252.500|20110107141255.000|TR0|
20110107141255.000|20110107141257.500|TR0|The American occupation turned
20110107141257.500|20110107141300.000|TR0|Iraq into a battlefield as well
20110107141300.000|20110107141302.500|TR0|as sewing the seeds of political
20110107141302.500|20110107141305.000|TR0|corruption.  How can Americans
20110107141305.000|20110107141307.500|TR0|stand back and watch without
20110107141307.500|20110107141310.000|TR0|intervening in this situation?
20110107141310.000|20110107141312.500|TR0|Everybody knows about the
20110107141312.500|20110107141315.000|TR0|failure of the Iraqi economy.
20110107141315.000|20110107141317.500|TR0|It has fallen to 70 if not 90
20110107141317.500|20110107141320.000|TR0|percent of what it used to be.
20110107141320.000|20110107141323.333|TR0|This is having a terrible effect
20110107141323.333|20110107141326.667|TR0|on the ground, both socially and
20110107141326.667|20110107141330.000|TR0|economically.
20110107141330.000|20110107141332.500|TR0|
20110107141332.500|20110107141335.000|TR0|Experts worry about the children
20110107141335.000|20110107141337.500|TR0|who grow up too poor to go to
20110107141337.500|20110107141340.000|TR0|school. Without an education,
20110107141340.000|20110107141342.500|TR0|they are easily preyed on by

20110107141352.500|20110107141355.000|TR0|
20110107141355.000|20110107141357.500|TR0|Mohammed (Unemployed 19
20110107141357.500|20110107141400.000|TR0|year-old) How can I fulfill a
20110107141400.000|20110107141402.500|TR0|dream when I live in fear.  I
20110107141402.500|20110107141405.000|TR0|cant accomplish anything.  We

20110107141410.000|20110107141412.500|TR0|even though theres no work.  We

20110107141415.000|20110107141417.500|TR0|We dont want anything but
20110107141417.500|20110107141420.000|TR0|security.
20110107141420.000|20110107141422.500|TR0|
20110107141422.500|20110107141425.000|TR0|Iraq remains a very dangerous
20110107141425.000|20110107141427.500|TR0|place where kidnappings and
20110107141427.500|20110107141430.000|TR0|murders are part of daily life.
20110107141430.000|20110107141432.500|TR0|For these Shiia families, living
20110107141432.500|20110107141435.000|TR0|on a trash heap is still better

20110107141437.500|20110107141440.000|TR0|back home. But, until that is

20110107141452.500|20110107141455.000|TR0|collect trash in order to

20110107141607.500|20110107141610.000|TR0|
20110107141610.000|20110107141612.500|TR0|Theyve clearly been waiting for
20110107141612.500|20110107141615.000|TR0|us. After that we had to spend

20110107141625.000|20110107141627.500|TR0|from my bag. They told me to

20110107141630.000|20110107141632.500|TR0|didnt allow me to get in touch
20110107141632.500|20110107141635.000|TR0|with the Russian consul until

20110107141637.500|20110107141640.000|TR0|questioning session, whatever

20110107141642.500|20110107141645.000|TR0|a person there who introduced

20110107141647.500|20110107141650.000|TR0|agent. He told me he wanted to

20110107141655.000|20110107141657.500|TR0|intentions here. He had a long

20110107141700.000|20110107141702.500|TR0|wanted to ask. However, I told

20110107141725.000|20110107141727.500|TR0|and why he had been arrested. I
20110107141727.500|20110107141730.000|TR0|answered that I didnt know why

20110107141740.000|20110107141742.500|TR0|

20110107141745.000|20110107141747.500|TR0|York after being extradited from
20110107141747.500|20110107141750.000|TR0|Thailand last November.
20110107141750.000|20110107141752.500|TR0|
20110107141752.500|20110107141755.000|TR0|He was arrested in Bangkok in
20110107141755.000|20110107141757.500|TR0|2008 during a U.S. sting
20110107141757.500|20110107141800.000|TR0|operation.
20110107141800.000|20110107141802.500|TR0|

20110107141805.000|20110107141807.500|TR0|including supplying weapons to
20110107141807.500|20110107141810.000|TR0|terrorist groups and conspiring

20110107141812.500|20110107141815.000|TR0|

20110107142600.000|20110107142602.500|TR0|13 days later...  The difference
20110107142602.500|20110107142605.000|TR0|in dates is because Russian
20110107142605.000|20110107142607.500|TR0|Christmas falls on the 7th of
20110107142607.500|20110107142610.000|TR0|January, following the old -
20110107142610.000|20110107142612.500|TR0|Julian calendar. But it wasnt
20110107142612.500|20110107142615.000|TR0|always this way. Sergeys
20110107142615.000|20110107142617.500|TR0|parents celebrated Christmas in
20110107142617.500|20110107142620.000|TR0|much the same way as the rest of
20110107142620.000|20110107142622.500|TR0|the world - on Dec.25. But the
20110107142622.500|20110107142625.000|TR0|Bolshevik revolution changed it
20110107142625.000|20110107142627.500|TR0|all.
20110107142627.500|20110107142630.000|TR0|
20110107142630.000|20110107142632.500|TR0|SERGEY GERBILSKY, ORTHODOX

20110107142635.000|20110107142637.500|TR0|
20110107142637.500|20110107142640.000|TR0|'They simply moved Christmas
20110107142640.000|20110107142642.500|TR0|tree to New Years, they moved

20110107142645.000|20110107142647.500|TR0|moved Santa Clause to New Years

20110107142652.500|20110107142655.000|TR0|Sergey is a child of the Soviet

20110107142703.333|20110107142706.667|TR0|only after its collapse in 1991

20110107142720.000|20110107142722.500|TR0|'We cook lent dishes on
